verses.text: Alleluia, \add a Psalm\add* of Agg√¶us and Zacharias.\f + \fr 147:1 \ft In the original text, the following verses are numbered 12 to 20.\f* Praise the Lord, O Jerusalem; praise thy God, O Sion.
For he has strengthened the bars of thy gates; he has blessed thy children within thee.
He makes thy borders peaceful, and fills thee with the \f + \fr 147:3 \fqa Lit. \ft fat of wheat.\f*flour of wheat.
He sends his oracle to the earth: his word will run swiftly.
He gives snow like wool: he scatters the mist like ashes.
Casting \add forth\add* his ice like morsels: who shall stand before his cold?
He shall send out his word, and melt them: he shall blow \add with\add* his wind, and the waters shall flow.
He sends his word to Jacob, his ordinances and judgments to Israel.
He has not done so to \f + \fr 147:9 \fqa Gr. \ft every.\f*any \add other\add* nation; and he has not shewn them his judgments.
